meanings.definition: The quality or state of having three dimensions.
meanings.sent1: The tridimensionality of the cube made it look real.
meanings.sent2: Artists often strive to capture tridimensionality in their sculptures.
meanings.sent3: The tridimensionality of the cake was so impressive that it seemed to pop out of the plate.
meanings.sent4: Her drawing lacked tridimensionality, appearing flat like a piece of paper.
meanings.sent5: The tridimensionality of the virtual reality game made players feel like they were inside the world.

meanings.definition: The property of existing in three dimensions.
meanings.sent1: The tridimensionality of the building added depth to the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: Virtual reality technology aims to create tridimensionality in digital environments.
meanings.sent3: The tridimensionality of the jigsaw puzzle made it challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling had a tridimensionality that brought the characters to life in the listeners' minds.
meanings.sent5: The tridimensionality of the hologram amazed the audience, making them feel like they could touch it.
